title: Binary entropy function
summary: In information theory, the binary entropy function, denoted H ⁡ ( p ) {\displaystyle \operatorname {H} (p)} or H b ⁡ ( p ) {\displaystyle \operatorname {H} _{\text{b}}(p)} , is defined as the entropy of a Bernoulli process with probability p {\displaystyle p} of one of two values. It is a special case of H ( X ) {\displaystyle \mathrm {H} (X)} , the entropy function. Mathematically, the Bernoulli trial is modelled as a random variable X {\displaystyle X} that can take on only two values: 0 and 1, which are mutually exclusive and exhaustive.
